definition: Northeast China/Manchuria/lit. east of Shanhai Pass 山海關|山海关[Shan1 hai3 guan1]/Kantō region of Japan
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan
surname Dong
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
Kantō earthquake of 1923, magnitude 8.2, that killed 200,000 people in the Tokyo area
oden, Japanese dish made with boiled eggs, processed fish cakes, daikon radish, tofu etc in a kelp-based broth
Japanese Kwantung army (or Kantō army), notorious for numerous atrocities in China during WWII

sentences.english: Before the Great Kanto Earthquake struck, Japan was full of optimism.
sentences.chinese: 在关东大地震之前，日本人民都是乐观的。

sentences.english: The second part expounds the impact on the integration of human resources.
sentences.chinese: “闯关东”对人力资源整合的影响。

sentences.english: The Great Kanto Earthquake obliterated all of that in a single afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 关东大地震在仅仅一个下午的时间就毁掉了这一切。

sentences.english: Last time I stayed in the kanto regio, Tokyo area and nearby.
sentences.chinese: 上次我住在关东雷乔，东京及附近地区。

sentences.english: More than 100,000 people died during the Kanto quake and its aftermath.
sentences.chinese: 一共有超过十万人死于关东大地震期间。
关东军指挥官植田谦吉？

sentences.english: The plant had already suffered a couple ofexplosions in the aftermath of the Tohoku-Kanto earthquake on March. 11.
sentences.chinese: 核电站在3月11日的关东大地震后遭受几次的爆炸。

definition: Kansai region, Japan/Guanxi or Kuanhsi town in Hsinchu County 新竹縣|新竹县[Xin1 zhu2 Xian4], northwest Taiwan

(orig.) tents forming the offices of a commanding officer/administration of a military government/(medieval Japan) "bakufu", administration of the shogun
Jishou county level city in Hengshui 衡水[Heng2 shui3], Hebei

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
Goguryeo (37 BC-668 AD), one of the Korean Three Kingdoms
Emishi or Ebisu, ethnic group of ancient Japan, thought to be related to modern Ainus
Korean Goryeo dynasty, 918-1392/Korea, esp. in context of art and culture

ODA Nobunaga (1534-1582), Japanese shogun (warlord), played an important role in unifying Japan
